most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues and False Positive Detection
common_issues.description: Users reported Pieces OS disconnections and restarts, resolved by deleting the 'com.pieces.os' folder. This action also removes saved snippets and chats. A separate issue involved Intego VirusBarrier flagging Pieces OS as malware, identified as a likely false positive requiring virus definition updates.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS
_PiecesOS Information_

**ID:** 18986c5c-5aef-40f4-ac00-93da40fd8b47
**User:** 1446bb64-5370-4644-a0ee-5ab3b4f3a7ac
**Current Version:** Unknown
**Min Version Supported:** 11.0.0
**Max Version Supported:** 12.0.0
**Local Port:** 127.0.0.1:39300

_Device Information_

**Operating System:** Windows
**Current Version:** "Windows 10 Pro" 10.0 (Build 26100)
**Min Version Supported:** Windows 10 Build 1903

Pieces for developers always loosing connection and self closing pieces OS
## Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* Rafael-a-g-n reported an issue with Pieces OS disconnecting and restarting frequently.
* Laborer123 and Tsavo-at-pieces identified the problem as needing to delete the com.pieces.os folder from Documents.
* Rafael-a-g-n confirmed that deleting the folder resolved the issue.
* Tsavo-at-pieces noted that a patch would be released to address alternative installation locations.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS disconnecting and restarting repeatedly.
* Incorrect installation location causing issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Deleting the com.pieces.os folder from Documents.
* Patch to handle alternative installation locations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is resolved for users who delete the com.pieces.os folder.
* A patch is being released to address alternative installation locations.

**Additional Notes:**

* Deleting the com.pieces.os folder will also remove saved code snippets and copilot chats.
* Users can contact Pieces support if they want to repair the database instead of deleting the folder.

related_issues.title: OSX/Nukesped.ext reported by VirusBarrier
related_issues.text:
OSX/Nukesped.ext reported by VirusBarrier
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Intego VirusBarrier has quarantined the following Apps as being infected with OSX/Nukesped.ext

- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App
- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App
- /Library/Caches/com.pieces.os/org.sparkle-project.Sparkle/Installation/rXFHYYDjc/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/32bfc7dc-fda4-4377-8eb1-348cab1106b6)



## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User (idiston) reported an issue where Intego VirusBarrier flagged the Pieces OS application framework as infected with OSX/NukeSped.ext malware.
* Initial research indicated it was a false positive detection likely caused by outdated virus definitions.

**Solutions Proposed:**

* Update Intego VirusBarrier virus definitions.
* Report the detection as a false positive to Intego.
* Temporarily trust the flagged files through VirusBarrier's interface.

**Outcome:**

* The user's problem has been identified and solutions have been proposed.
* The team will investigate further and provide additional support if needed.

**Current Status:**

* Open - awaiting user response.

recommendations: Investigate and resolve the root cause of Pieces OS disconnections and restarts.
Collaborate with Intego to address the false positive detection by VirusBarrier and update their virus definitions.
Provide clear instructions to users on how to resolve the Pieces OS connection issue, including steps to back up their data before deleting the 'com.pieces.os' folder.
Consider alternative installation locations for Pieces OS to avoid potential conflicts.
Monitor support channels for similar issues and update documentation and FAQs accordingly.
Communicate the resolution of these issues to affected users and the wider user base.
